page.title: 03Crocadon Farm Crops
page.content: Mr.Bush's farm is split into two parts. One half is based at Crocadon whilst the remainder is located at Viverdon Down one mile away. Half the acreage is in permanent pasture. On the rest is grown 90 acres of{barley,}5 acres of{potatoes}and 3 acres of{maize.}The latter is harvest- ed unripened by forage harvester and used for high grade silage. About 40 acres of intensively grown grass is also cropped for silage. An agricultural contractor is hired for all harvest operations.The{silage}crop is taken by trailer to the old mill pond which has been converted into a silage pit.There the crop is preserved by sealing down with black plastic sheeting until required for winter feed. Some of the{barley}corn is also kept for animal feed but the bulk is sold to corn merchants.
